About this wiki

History & Developments

You can read the history and developments of this wiki.

Usage

Wiki syntax

Please learn the wiki Formatting Syntax first if you are not familiar with Dokuwiki; and you may practise in the PlayGround

Animation syntax

Please refer to the animation example page and plugin page to learn how to insert animations into wiki pages and use the HTML animation interface.

Math syntax

Please refer to the mathematical formula page to learn how to insert mathematical formulae into wiki pages. I assume you have learned enough knowledge about TeX/LaTeX.

Access permission

Ordinary visitors and registered users have different permissions:

  • all visitors can read/edit any page
  • registered users are allowed to create new pages

Uploading

As this wiki is financially supported by Yihui alone, the space is quite limited for uploading materials; thus you may consider uploading your stuff to other file/image hosting sites, e.g.

  • Images: Photobucket (recommended1)), Picasa, or Flickr, etc.
  • Files: MediaFile, etc.

Or you can just send the files to me via Email xie [at] yihui [dot] name and I'll upload them for you (to R-Forge).

Browsing

The recommended screen resolution is 1280×1024 px, as many animations are wider than 600px or higher than 600px. In that case, 800×600 px is a little bit too low, and 1024×768 might not be high enough to view all parts of the animation (including the controlling buttons, etc). Besides, the animations are driven by JS code, so make sure your browser supports JS or you have enabled JS in your browser.

Support

There is a project at R-Forge: http://r-forge.r-project.org/projects/animation/ In this project, you can use the mailing list to get help.

Here is the project home page: http://animation.r-forge.r-project.org/

Besides, you may also use the Google Group Animation in Statistics to obtain support.
